page.title: 08THE ABBOT'S WAY contd.
page.content: Westhay built the heavy, wooden track to link the two areas. The track was {2500 metres long.}It is made of wood. Alder planks or split logs were laid side by side with smaller branches placed in the gaps to form a heavy solid trackway. By the side of the road thin, long pegs were hammered into the marsh to hold the track in place. The pegs may also have helped the men to find the track when the area was flooded. Over 30,000 alder planks of about one metre long were used in the track as well as 15,000 pegs. The track was used for a few years but it was gradually covered over by the vegetation of the bog. It is now buried under several metres of earth.
